DataElement.preferredName: Recurrent Disease, Distant Site Medical Examination Clinical Diagnosis ICD-O-3 Morphology Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms._A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)_Five-digit codes representing the histology  (morphology) of neoplasms from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3). The first four digits indicate the specific histological term. The fifth digit after the slash or solidus (/) is a behaviour code which indicates whether a tumour is malignant, benign, in situ, or uncertain whether benign or malignant.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms._A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Recurrence of symptoms of a disease, at a site different and away from the original site.
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A diagnosis made from a study of the signs and symptoms of a disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Five-digit codes representing the histology  (morphology) of neoplasms from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (ICD-O-3). The first four digits indicate the specific histological term. The fifth digit after the slash or solidus (/) is a behaviour code which indicates whether a tumour is malignant, benign, in situ, or uncertain whether benign or malignant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, third edition (ICD-O-3).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.
